urban.title: The Shadowed Alley
descriptions: A guttering lantern throws your shadow against damp brick while low voices trade over wrapped bundles. Spice and stale rainwater mingle in the air, edged by the copper tang of fresh blood. Fog carries clipped whispers as a few bare blades catch the light. Half-seen door seams and watching eyes make the alley feel tight and dangerous.

Garbage piles breathe steam in the narrow passage where bootfalls echo like drum beats. A cutpurse's dropped pouch spills silver into the muck while cloaked figures melt into doorways. Overhead, washing lines drip onto worn cobbles that remember a thousand midnight deals. The walls lean close, and every shadow could conceal a knife or a witness.

resolutions.title: Street Justice
resolutions.description: The confrontation ends with the criminals fleeing into the urban maze, but not before dropping evidence linking them to a larger operation. The party can choose to pursue immediately through dangerous territory, or gather allies and return with reinforcements at dawn. Local residents emerge cautiously, offering thanks and information about the criminal network's next target.
resolutions.requirements: Successful combat or intimidation checks, investigation of dropped evidence
resolutions.rewards: Gratitude from local residents, information network access, possible guide through dangerous districts

resolutions.title: Darker Bargains
resolutions.description: The encounter reveals that the criminals are desperate refugees being extorted by a corrupt city official. The party must decide whether to turn them in for the bounty, help them escape the city, or confront the official and risk making a powerful enemy. Each choice has immediate consequences for the alley's residents.
resolutions.requirements: Insight checks to uncover the truth, persuasion or deception to navigate the moral dilemma
resolutions.rewards: Choice of: bounty money, criminal contacts, evidence against corrupt official, or refugees' heartfelt gratitude

urban.title: Rooftop Chase
descriptions: Terracotta shingles and laundry lines blur beneath your boots as bells toll across the skyline. Wind snaps cloaks and catching lines threaten to pitch you toward the streets below. Chimney sweeps shout warnings while roosting griffins shriek at the commotion. Each leap is a hard bargain with gravity and slick tile.

Moonlight silvers the roof slates as your quarry races through a forest of chimneys and weathervanes. Guild signs creak on chains below while you balance on rain-slick ridges, the whole city sprawling beneath like a carpet of fireflies. The figure ahead drops a smoke bomb that billows across the tiles—through the haze you catch glimpses of their desperate flight toward the cathedral spires.

resolutions.title: Cornered Confession
resolutions.description: The chase ends at a dead-end rooftop with nowhere left to run. The cornered figure, revealed to be an informant fleeing assassins, offers a desperate bargain: protection in exchange for information about a conspiracy reaching the highest levels of city power. The party hears approaching footsteps—the real hunters are closing in.
resolutions.requirements: Successful athletics/acrobatics checks to keep pace, insight to understand the situation
resolutions.rewards: Valuable conspiracy information, potential ally informant, involvement in larger political intrigue

resolutions.title: The Escape Artist
resolutions.description: Your quarry proves too skilled, vanishing into a hidden passage between chimney stacks. But they leave behind a satchel dropped in haste—inside are coded messages, a map of secret routes through the city's rooftops, and a single black feather that radiates faint magic. The escape creates more questions than answers.
resolutions.requirements: Chase continues but quarry escapes, investigation of dropped items
resolutions.rewards: Map of rooftop pathways (advantage on future urban chases), coded messages, mysterious magical feather

urban.title: The Abandoned Warehouse
descriptions: Dust-choked crates form a claustrophobic maze, and smudged sigils flare for a heartbeat when you brush a lid. Floorboards groan and answer with hollow knocks that echo through the rafters. Soft scuffing moves between the pallets when you pause to listen. The air tastes of rust and old rope fibers.

Shafts of grimy light pierce the gloom where crates sit stacked to the ceiling like a child's toy blocks. Fresh bootprints disturb decades of dust, leading to a cleared space where strange alchemical equipment still bubbles softly. Loading doors hang askew on rusted chains, and something large recently dragged itself across the warped floorboards toward the river exit.

resolutions.title: Smuggler's Network Exposed
resolutions.description: The warehouse is a hub for a sophisticated smuggling operation moving cursed artifacts into the city. The party discovers ledgers naming corrupt customs officials and a schedule of incoming shipments. They can seize the evidence and alert authorities, negotiate with the smugglers for a cut and information, or shut down the operation themselves.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of crates and documents, stealth or combat to handle guards
resolutions.rewards: Smuggling ledgers (evidence against officials), share of valuable contraband, or reputation with city watch

resolutions.title: Something Worse Beneath
resolutions.description: The warehouse is just a cover—beneath the floorboards lies an entrance to forgotten catacombs where something ancient has awakened. The scuffing sounds belong to pale humanoids emerging at night to feed. The alchemical equipment was an attempt to study them that went horribly wrong. The party must decide whether to seal the entrance, investigate deeper, or alert the city to evacuate nearby districts.
resolutions.requirements: Discovery of hidden entrance, survival check to notice danger signs, knowledge checks about the creatures
resolutions.rewards: Ancient catacomb map, researcher's notes on the creatures, disturbing knowledge of what lies under the city

urban.title: Market District Mystery
descriptions: Merchants hawk fragrant spices over hushed talk about a missing official. Under layered awnings, you spot chalk marks on posts and glimpse ledgers passed hand to hand. Street performers juggle knives and bright illusions that swallow faces in reflected color. The crowd presses and sways, its mood tilting with every new whisper.

The bazaar churns with desperate energy—merchants shouting prices while pickpockets work the crush. But beneath the commerce flows a current of fear: three stalls stand empty, their owners vanished overnight. Street urchins press notes into palms for copper, and the city watch questions vendors with increasing aggression. Something has the market spooked, and everyone seems to know more than they're saying.

resolutions.title: Conspiracy Unmasked
resolutions.description: The missing official didn't vanish—they faked their disappearance after discovering a price-fixing scheme involving guild masters and city councilors. The party finds them hiding in a safe house, torn between exposing the conspiracy and protecting their family from retaliation. The evidence is damning, but going public will shake the city's economy and make powerful enemies.
resolutions.requirements: Successful investigation and persuasion checks, following chalk mark trail, gaining informant trust
resolutions.rewards: Official's gratitude and future political favors, or conspiracy evidence to use as leverage, economic reform reputation

resolutions.title: The Shapeshifter's Game
resolutions.description: The official isn't missing—they're replaced. A doppelganger has taken their place and is slowly replacing other key figures in the market district. The party discovers the pattern: missing persons, subtle personality changes, and a hidden lair beneath the old fountain. They must expose the infiltrator without causing city-wide panic, and decide what to do with the real official trapped in stasis.
resolutions.requirements: Insight checks to notice behavioral inconsistencies, investigation of disappearances, stealth to discover lair
resolutions.rewards: Rescued official's reward, doppelganger's stolen identity kit, knowledge of remaining infiltrators to root out

urban.title: Sewer Expedition
descriptions: Sluggish canals of alchemical runoff glow sickly green, painting the brick in wavering light. The slap of unseen tails and the drip of mineral-rich condensation set a steady rhythm. Vermin watch from culvert mouths while worn symbols along the walls pulse faintly. Each step through the muck threatens a stumble and a cold plunge.

The tunnels breathe with the city's waste—a warm, fetid wind that carries distant chanting. Corroded grates overhead leak pale daylight onto ceremonial markings scrawled in something that isn't paint. Fresh candles float in the effluent, still burning, and the rats flee ahead of you in squeaking waves. Whatever made the symbols is down here right now.

resolutions.title: Cult Disrupted
resolutions.description: Deep in the sewers, the party discovers a doomsday cult preparing to poison the city's water supply. Their leader, a charismatic zealot, offers a choice: join them in 'cleansing' the corrupt city above, or fight through plague-ridden fanatics to destroy their alchemical apparatus. Time is short—the poison is already mixed, and the cultists are willing to die for their cause.
resolutions.requirements: Navigate sewer hazards, combat or persuasion with cultists, disable alchemical device
resolutions.rewards: City's gratitude and substantial reward, cult intelligence, confiscated alchemical formulas, or cult alliance if morally compromised

resolutions.title: Plague Source Contained
resolutions.description: The expedition reveals the source of the recent illness outbreak: a breached vault containing failed biological experiments from a war decades past. The contamination is spreading through the water system. The party must choose between a dangerous containment ritual that might cost lives, collapsing the tunnels to seal it (cutting off parts of the city), or risking transport of samples to find a cure.
resolutions.requirements: Survival checks to avoid infection, knowledge of history/arcana to understand the threat, difficult moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Cure research (leads to grateful healers' guild), ancient military records, sealed biohazard gear, tragic knowledge

urban.title: The Clocktower District
descriptions: Clockwork towers toll the hour as brass gears grind against a troubling misalignment. Steam shrouds the streets in a warm haze that tastes of oil. Spires linked by maintenance catwalks demand careful timing, or a misstep will fling you toward spinning weights. Below, onlookers watch with heads tilted back and hands over ears.

The great clock faces show different times—a mechanical impossibility that has the district's chronologists in a panic. Gears the size of wagons stutter and reverse while temporal anomalies ripple through the air like heat shimmer. Workers are trapped on frozen catwalks between grinding mechanisms, and somewhere in the tower's heart, something is deliberately sabotaging the synchronized timepieces that regulate the entire city's schedule.

resolutions.title: Sabotage Prevented
resolutions.description: The party climbs through the tower's dangerous mechanisms to find a brilliant but bitter clockmaker executing revenge against the guild that stole his designs. They must talk him down before he destroys the mainspring, which would create a temporal shockwave. Success means capturing him for trial, but his knowledge of the hidden flaw in the tower's design is invaluable—and he's the only one who can fix it safely.
resolutions.requirements: Athletics/acrobatics to navigate moving machinery, persuasion to convince the saboteur, investigation to understand the mechanism
resolutions.rewards: Clockmaker's reluctant cooperation, guild reward, temporal knowledge, or saboteur's gratitude if helped to escape

resolutions.title: Time Unraveled
resolutions.description: The misalignment isn't sabotage—it's a defense mechanism. The tower was built on a temporal nexus, and something from the future is trying to break through. The party experiences brief flashes of possible futures while shutting down the tower's defenses would let whatever it is arrive. They must choose: keep the defenses running and live with unstable time, destroy the nexus, or open it and face what comes.
resolutions.requirements: Arcana checks to understand temporal magic, wisdom saves against time distortion, courage to face unknown future threat
resolutions.rewards: Glimpses of possible futures (campaign foreshadowing), temporal nexus shard (powerful magic item), or future entity's alliance/enmity

urban.title: Wharf at Midnight
descriptions: Salt mist swallows lantern light while barges slide in under unfamiliar colors. Ropes creak as sailors trade quick, low greetings above the slow lap of the tide. The planks are slick, and a single misstep would be loud here. Each wave reveals and erases footprints in moonlit grime.

Fog rolls thick between dock pilings where merchant ships rock in their berths. A cutter with no lights drifts to the private pier, its crew unloading crates with practiced silence. The harbormaster's office windows stay dark—they've been paid well to look the other way. But someone else watches from the warehouse shadows, and the smugglers' lookout just noticed your party.

resolutions.title: Smuggling Ring Exposed
resolutions.description: The party uncovers a sophisticated smuggling operation moving weapons to rebel forces in neighboring territories. The smugglers offer a substantial bribe for silence, knowing exposure means execution. The cargo includes both illegal weapons and humanitarian supplies for refugees. Turning them in serves the law but dooms innocents; taking the bribe makes the party complicit; stealing the cargo makes everyone an enemy.
resolutions.requirements: Stealth to observe operation, investigation of cargo, moral choice under pressure
resolutions.rewards: Choice of: substantial bribe money, harbor watch gratitude and future intel, confiscated weapons, or smugglers' gratitude and safe passage

resolutions.title: Foreign Agent Captured
resolutions.description: The midnight delivery is a cover for a spy exchange. One of the 'sailors' is a foreign agent carrying intelligence that could prevent or start a war. Multiple factions converge—rival spies, assassins, city watch, and foreign operatives. The party must decide who gets the agent, knowing their choice will have international consequences. Combat erupts on the fog-shrouded docks.
resolutions.requirements: Combat against multiple factions, quick decision-making under pressure, navigation of moral complexity
resolutions.rewards: Faction gratitude (chosen side), partial intelligence access, political leverage, dangerous new enemies, campaign-level consequences

urban.title: The Old Quarter
descriptions: Lean tenements huddle over cobbles etched with cracked warding marks. Wind funnels through alleys with the scent of damp stone and stove smoke. Shutters twitch and fall still as you pass, and voices drop to murmurs. The street feels tight with old pride and fresh anger.

The old district simmers with tension—protest signs lean against walls painted with revolutionary slogans. A crowd gathers at the fountain where a charismatic speaker denounces the merchant council's new taxes. City watch form a cordon at the district gate, hands on clubs. The residents remember when this quarter governed itself, and they're tired of being forgotten.

resolutions.title: Peaceful Protest Secured
resolutions.description: The party mediates between angry residents and nervous city watch before violence erupts. They discover the speaker is actually an agent provocateur sent to cause a riot that would justify martial law. Exposing the infiltrator defuses the situation, but the underlying grievances remain. The residents ask the party to carry their petition to the council—a simple errand that will make powerful enemies or allies.
resolutions.requirements: Insight to detect deception, persuasion to calm both sides, investigation to uncover the provocateur
resolutions.rewards: Residents' trust and safe haven in Old Quarter, city watch gratitude, petition document (potential campaign quest), or provocateur's employer exposed

resolutions.title: Revolution's First Spark
resolutions.description: The grievances are legitimate—the merchant council has been stealing from the Old Quarter for years. The party finds evidence of embezzlement, forced evictions, and disappeared community leaders. They must choose: side with the establishment and suppress the evidence, help organize legitimate resistance, or step aside and let the fury take its course. The city's future hinges on this moment.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of council corruption, moral choice with far-reaching consequences, potential combat if choosing sides
resolutions.rewards: Revolutionary alliance (Old Quarter becomes base), council favor (if suppressed), embezzlement evidence (leverage), campaign-altering political shift

urban.title: Festival of Masks
descriptions: Ribboned performers and masked revelers whirl beneath fireworks that smear symbols across the smoke. Music and laughter merge into a dizzying roar until a sharp cry cuts the noise. A cloaked figure drags someone behind a curtain of banners as lantern-lit stalls blur with the surge. Faces are hidden; trails vanish in confetti and color.

The annual Festival of Masks transforms the square into controlled chaos—nobles mingle anonymously with commoners, fortunes are won and lost at game stalls, and traditional beast-dances stomp through the crowd. But this year the celebration masks something sinister: three people wearing the Raven mask haven't been seen in hours, and a pattern of bloody handprints marks the alley behind the puppet theater. The crowd's joy could turn to stampeding terror at any moment.

resolutions.title: Kidnapping Thwarted
resolutions.description: The party tracks the abductor through festival crowds to a warehouse beneath the square. A desperate cult is collecting people born under the Raven constellation for a midnight ritual. The victims are alive but time is short—the party must fight through cultist guards, disrupt the ritual, and evacuate victims without alerting the festival crowd above and causing a deadly stampede.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation through festival chaos, stealth and combat in tight quarters, careful rescue operation
resolutions.rewards: Rescued victims' gratitude (one is a disguised noble), cult intelligence, ritual components, or noble's significant reward

resolutions.title: Assassination Prevented
resolutions.description: The disappearances are cover for a political assassination. A foreign agent is eliminating their own operatives who might expose the real target: a visiting dignitary watching from the festival balcony. The party has minutes to identify the assassin among thousands of masked celebrants, protect the target, and prevent an international incident. The wrong person accused could spark a riot.
resolutions.requirements: Insight and investigation under time pressure, protection of VIP, crowd control, possibly combat with master assassin
resolutions.rewards: Dignitary's immense gratitude and diplomatic favor, foreign agent intelligence network exposed, prevention of war, or capture of legendary assassin

urban.title: Guildhouse Heist
descriptions: Shattered wards and drifting illusion shards hang in the air like broken glass. The guildhouse crackles with stray magic that bends light and twists voices into whispers. Footsteps gather outside as new faces arrive to point fingers or pry at leftovers. Every hallway offers echoes and half-seen shapes.

The Mages' Guild vault sits open—an impossible feat that has the city's most powerful wizards in a panic. Magical alarms shriek and malfunction, casting wild illusions of the thieves still fleeing. But the real perpetrators left behind their calling card: a black rose and a note challenging the guild to find them. Rival guilds, city watch, and opportunistic looters converge on the scene, all with different agendas.

resolutions.title: Master Thieves Captured
resolutions.description: The party follows the magical trace left by stolen artifacts to the Thieves' Guild safehouse. What they find is unexpected: the thieves are former guild members, expelled for exposing corruption. The stolen items are evidence of illegal experiments on unwilling subjects. The party must choose between returning the 'evidence' to powerful mages who'll destroy it, or protecting the thieves and facing the guild's wrath.
resolutions.requirements: Tracking magical signatures, investigation of guild corruption, combat or negotiation with thieves, moral complexity
resolutions.rewards: Mages' Guild gratitude and training (if evidence returned), Thieves' Guild alliance (if protected), corruption evidence, magical items from either side

resolutions.title: Internal Conspiracy Exposed
resolutions.description: Investigation reveals no external thieves—this was an inside job. A guild master staged the heist to cover their embezzlement and frame a rival. The party uncovers ledgers, secret rooms, and witnesses. But the corrupt master is politically connected and warns that exposing them will destroy the party's reputation in the city. They must decide whether to take the offered bribe, pursue justice regardless, or use the evidence as leverage.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of guild politics, uncovering hidden evidence, navigating power structures, moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Choice of: substantial bribe, justice served (reputation boost), leverage over powerful mage, political entanglement, guild reform

urban.title: Basilica of Echoing Confessions
descriptions: Curved domes catch stray whispers and feed them back as soft choruses that linger in the nave. Tonight the hymn swells into something sharp enough to raise hairs on your arms. Incense curls thick as fog around marble pillars etched with words of contrition. Faces turn toward the choir as private words bleed into the open.

The basilica's acoustics are legendary—a whisper at the altar can be heard in the furthest pew. But tonight the building is betraying its purpose: confessions meant for priests alone echo through the halls for all to hear. Dark secrets spill into public space while horrified worshippers realize their most private sins are being broadcast. The high priest suspects sabotage, but the truth might be divine judgment.

resolutions.title: Architectural Sabotage
resolutions.description: The party discovers someone has subtly modified the basilica's resonance chambers to amplify and broadcast specific confession booths. The saboteur is a disgraced architect seeking revenge on the clergy who ruined their career. They've also planted evidence that will be revealed during tomorrow's high ceremony, exposing corruption in the church hierarchy. The party must choose between stopping the architect or letting the truth emerge.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of acoustic modifications, architecture/engineering knowledge, confrontation with saboteur, moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Church gratitude and blessing (if stopped), architect's gratitude and evidence (if helped), exposed church corruption, magical acoustic device

resolutions.title: Divine Manifestation
resolutions.description: The echoing confessions aren't sabotage—they're a miracle. A deity is forcing the truth into the open to cleanse the temple of hypocrites. The revealed sins include a murder confession, theft from the poor fund, and a conspiracy to assassinate a bishop. The party must navigate the religious and political fallout, decide who to protect, and determine if they should interfere with divine will at all.
resolutions.requirements: Religion checks to understand divine intervention, investigation of revealed crimes, wisdom to navigate theological crisis, social challenges
resolutions.rewards: Divine blessing or curse (depending on choices), criminal confessions to investigate, political leverage, theological reputation, campaign-altering church crisis

urban.title: Night Watch Mutiny
descriptions: Overturned carts form barricades between tight ranks of captains and rookies. Rain-slick cobbles glimmer in torchlight while citizens peer from shutters and then vanish. Each shouted order cracks against stone like a drumbeat. The air holds still, waiting for a single shove to start the rush.

Half the city watch has mutinied over unpaid wages and brutal conditions. Veterans square off against loyalist officers in the district square, both sides armed and furious. Citizens are trapped in their homes as the standoff drags toward dawn. The watch captain, corrupt but maintaining order, faces off against a reform-minded sergeant who won't back down. One wrong word could turn this into a bloodbath.

resolutions.title: Peaceful Compromise
resolutions.description: The party negotiates between both factions, uncovering the truth: the captain has been skimming wages, but the reformers are backed by a criminal syndicate wanting to destabilize law enforcement. Neither side has clean hands. The party must broker a deal that addresses legitimate grievances while preventing criminal takeover. Success means reform and new allies; failure means either tyranny or chaos.
resolutions.requirements: High persuasion and insight checks, investigation of both sides, negotiation under extreme pressure, balanced judgment
resolutions.rewards: Reformed watch gratitude and reliable allies, exposed criminal conspiracy, city stability maintained, political reputation boost

resolutions.title: Choose a Side
resolutions.description: Compromise isn't possible—the party must pick a faction and help them win. Siding with the captain means suppressing legitimate reform but maintaining order and gaining a powerful if corrupt ally. Siding with reformers means fighting experienced officers but establishing a just watch and earning the people's trust. Either choice means combat, casualties, and long-term consequences for city politics.
resolutions.requirements: Combat with chosen enemy faction, moral choice with major consequences, tactical decision-making
resolutions.rewards: Chosen faction's gratitude and significant influence, enemy faction's lasting enmity, city power structure shift, campaign-level political change

urban.title: Skybridge Duel at Dawn
descriptions: A duelist's seconds tighten ceremonial harnesses as sunrise paints the span in molten gold. The bridge's cables hum while spectators cluster on distant rooftops. Loose anchors, hidden shapes, and watchful gargoyles add edges you can feel but not name. One misstep could send anyone into the mist below.

The skybridge sways in dawn wind as two nobles prepare for a duel of honor. But this isn't ceremonial—someone has sabotaged the bridge's support cables, and the gathered crowd doesn't realize they're standing on a death trap. The duelists are ignorant pawns in an assassination plot. The party has minutes to identify the saboteur, prevent the bridge collapse, and stop the duel without causing a scandal that would shame both noble houses.

resolutions.title: Honor Preserved
resolutions.description: The party exposes the assassination plot and identifies the saboteur: a rival house hoping both duelists would die and blame fall on each other's families, starting a war. Quick action prevents the collapse and saves everyone. The grateful nobles call off their duel and unite against the common enemy. The party earns favor from two powerful houses but makes a deadly enemy of the third.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation under time pressure, engineering check to identify sabotage, persuasion to stop duel, possibly combat with saboteur
resolutions.rewards: Two noble houses' gratitude and patronage, prevented assassination, exposure of conspiracy, deadly rival house enemy

resolutions.title: Duel Concluded
resolutions.description: Unable to stop events in time, the party focuses on evacuating spectators and stabilizing the bridge long enough for the duel to conclude. One duelist falls—whether by opponent's blade or failing bridge is ambiguous. The survivor swears it was honorable combat, but the dead noble's family suspects foul play and demands the party's testimony. The party must choose what truth to tell, knowing their words will either prevent or ignite a house war.
resolutions.requirements: Engineering/athletics to prevent total collapse, survival during partial bridge failure, social navigation of aftermath, moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Survivor's gratitude or enmity (based on testimony), potential house war prevented or started, tragic knowledge, bridge engineering insights

urban.title: Arcane Tram Derailment
descriptions: Lightning-fed rails shriek while a levitating tram car dangles over a packed plaza. Sparks cascade like wild fireworks as robed technicians brace sigil-stamped tools against the conduit. Onlookers crowd the edges despite shouted warnings. The car tilts, groans, and drops an inch that steals breaths.

The tram system's main car hangs by failing levitation spells, packed with morning commuters. Arcane conduits overload and discharge random magic—one passenger is slowly turning to stone, another is floating toward the gap, and the driver has been polymorphed into a terrified sheep. The technicians' guild is arguing over procedure while the tram drops another foot. Someone needs to act now, procedures be damned.

resolutions.title: Heroic Rescue
resolutions.description: The party organizes a desperate rescue operation, using magic and improvisation to evacuate passengers before the tram falls. They must stabilize the levitation spell, create escape routes, dispel random magical effects, and keep the crowd from stampeding. Success saves everyone and makes the party city heroes. Failure means casualties and a disaster the city won't forget.
resolutions.requirements: Arcana checks to stabilize magic, athletics/acrobatics for rescue work, crowd control, teamwork under pressure, creative problem-solving
resolutions.rewards: City-wide hero status, grateful passengers (influential contacts), technicians' guild favor, commendation from city council, possible magic item reward

resolutions.title: Sabotage Uncovered
resolutions.description: While working to prevent disaster, the party discovers this wasn't an accident—someone deliberately overloaded the conduits. The saboteur is still present, trying to ensure maximum casualties to discredit the technicians' guild so their rivals can take over the city's transit contract. The party must simultaneously prevent disaster and stop the saboteur from triggering a complete system failure that would drop every tram in the city.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation during crisis, arcana to identify sabotage, combat with saboteur while managing ongoing disaster, prevent catastrophic failure
resolutions.rewards: Prevented city-wide catastrophe, saboteur captured, corporate conspiracy exposed, technicians' guild massive gratitude, transit system reform

urban.title: Stormglass Conservatory Siege
descriptions: Crystalline greenhouses fracture as the captured storm inside surges against the panes. Glass sings with a rising hum that turns every footstep into a risk. Scholars shout over the wind while living vines whip at curtains of slicing hail. The domes flicker, one crack away from bursting into glittering rain.

The conservatory's experimental weather dome is failing catastrophically. Inside, impossible plants from across the planes grow wild, fed by a contained hurricane that's breaking free. Scholars are trapped among carnivorous flowers and lightning-fruit trees while the glass ceiling develops spreading cracks. Outside, a protest group claims the conservatory's weather manipulation has been causing droughts in poor districts. They're threatening to shatter the dome themselves.

resolutions.title: Storm Contained
resolutions.description: The party enters the chaotic conservatory to rescue trapped scholars and stabilize the storm before it breaks free and devastates the district. They must navigate aggressive plant life, dodgearcane weather phenomena, and find the control mechanism—all while the glass shatters piece by piece. Success saves the conservatory and its irreplaceable specimens. But the protesters' drought accusations prove accurate, forcing the party to decide whether to expose the conservatory's crimes.
resolutions.requirements: Nature/arcana to handle magical plants, survival in extreme weather, rescue operation, investigation of drought claims, moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Scholars' gratitude, rare plant specimens, weather magic knowledge, drought evidence (leverage or justice), conservatory reform or exposure

resolutions.title: Controlled Destruction
resolutions.description: The storm can't be contained—it must be released in a controlled manner to prevent catastrophic dome failure. The party works with both protesters and scholars to evacuate the area and direct the storm's release safely. But once freed, the storm reveals its true nature: it's a captured elemental prince seeking revenge. The party must negotiate with an angry storm entity while preventing it from destroying the city in retribution.
resolutions.requirements: Evacuation coordination, nature/arcana to communicate with elemental, diplomacy with angry storm prince, possible combat or bargaining
resolutions.rewards: Elemental prince's boon (if negotiated well), protesters' gratitude, end of drought, storm magic knowledge, or elemental curse if handled poorly

urban.title: Moonlit Menagerie Escape
urban.description: Exotic beasts prowl moon-washed paths with cage doors hanging open on twisted hinges. Perfumed night-blooming flowers barely mask the musk of restless predators. From jeweled songbirds to a pacing manticore, every eye tracks your movement. A wrong noise could set the whole garden running.

urban.title: Tax Collector's Uprising
urban.description: Ledgers burn in braziers while clerks and citizens surge through the countinghouse doors. Ink-smudged broadsheets flutter underfoot amid shouted accusations and the clatter of upended desks. A pale, translucent figure coalesces above the ledgers, tallying with an echoing scrape of quill on stone. The crowd recoils, then roars louder.

urban.title: Cursed Foundry Reawakening
urban.description: Cold furnaces thump awake and molten channels sputter to life along the floor. The heat crushes the breath, warping iron tools into twisted shapes while sparks sketch figures in the smoke. Chains twitch and hammers jerk as if tugged by invisible hands. The roar builds until every surface glows at the edges.

urban.title: Back-Alley Apothecary Sting
urban.description: Perfumed smoke coils from corked vials arranged like jewels behind iron grating. Hooded buyers trade low words while heavy boots gather outside on wet stone. The bell above the door rings off-tempo, and shutters thud in unison. Labels are hand-scratched and some vials fizz; every eye searches for an exit.

urban.title: Guildhall Ball Intrigue
urban.description: Crystal chandeliers scatter constellations across the floor while masked patrons trade rumors like coin. The quartet swells, drowning the hiss of silk and the scrape of steel. Behind velvet curtains, you glimpse ledgers and sealed envelopes changing hands as toasts ring. Perfume, wax, and wine sweeten the air while every gaze weighs you.

urban.title: The Grand Bazaar
urban.description: A sprawling marketplace of colorful tents and bustling crowds, where merchants from distant lands hawk exotic goods. The air is thick with the smells of spices, perfumes, and roasting meats. Amidst the chaos, a pickpocket syndicate operates with impunity, and a mysterious plague is spreading through the city, with the bazaar as its epicenter.

urban.title: The Noble's Gala
urban.description: An exclusive gala hosted by a powerful noble family, where the city's elite gather to scheme and socialize. The ballroom glitters with jewels and whispers of political intrigue. A high-stakes card game is taking place in a smoke-filled backroom, and a scorned lover is plotting a very public revenge.

urban.title: The University's Forbidden Section
urban.description: A restricted area of the city's grand university, where forbidden knowledge is kept under lock and key. The air is thick with the smell of old parchment and the hum of powerful magic. A group of students is attempting to summon a demon, and a mad professor is conducting dangerous experiments with time.

urban.title: The Rooftop Garden
descriptions: A hidden oasis of green atop a towering building, offering a panoramic view of the city. The air is sweet with the scent of rare flowers and the buzz of honeybees. A secret society of druids tends to the garden, and a pair of star-crossed lovers meets here in secret.

Impossible greenery thrives on this sky-high refuge, tended by a hidden circle of urban druids who maintain nature's foothold in the stone jungle. Bee hives hum between flowering vines that shouldn't survive this altitude, and fruit trees bend with impossible harvests. But tonight the sanctuary has been discovered—corporate agents plan to seize it for a luxury development, and the druids prepare for a last stand.

resolutions.title: Sanctuary Preserved
resolutions.description: The party helps the druids defend their garden using legal channels, uncovering that the rooftop is actually protected sacred ground from the city's founding charter. They expose the corporate conspiracy and ensure the garden's protection. The grateful druids share their knowledge and grant access to rare plants and healing. The sanctuary becomes a safe haven for the party in the city's heart.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of legal documents, persuasion/intimidation with corporate agents, possible stealth or social combat, supporting druids
resolutions.rewards: Druid circle alliance, rare plant access, healing sanctuary, legal victory, urban nature magic knowledge

resolutions.title: Nature's Exodus
resolutions.description: The garden can't be saved—corporate power is too great. The party helps the druids perform a final ritual to transplant the garden's spirit to a new location outside the city. The plants wither and die in hours, leaving the rooftop barren. But the ritual reveals something unexpected: the garden was containing a planar breach to the Feywild. Now freed, fey creatures flood into the corporate building below, causing chaos and forcing evacuation.
resolutions.requirements: Nature/arcana for transplant ritual, rapid evacuation of druids and plants, managing Feywild breach consequences, moral reckoning
resolutions.rewards: Druid gratitude and relocation knowledge, Feywild contacts (chaotic), corporate enemy, bittersweet victory, transformed building becomes fey territory

urban.title: The Undercity Fight Club
descriptions: A brutal, no-holds-barred fighting tournament held in the city's sewers. The roar of the crowd is deafening, and the smell of blood and sweat is thick in the air. A desperate fighter is trying to win enough money to save his family, and a ruthless crime boss is fixing the matches.

Blood spatters the makeshift ring as fighters battle for screaming crowds in the torch-lit depths. The underground arena runs on desperation—debtors fighting for freedom, exiles seeking coin, and thrill-seekers risking death. But something's wrong tonight: fighters are dying in ways that don't match their wounds, and the crime boss running the show seems to be offering certain fighters to something in the shadows beyond the ring.

resolutions.title: Champion Emerges
resolutions.description: The party enters the tournament (or backs a fighter) and fights their way to the top, exposing the fixed matches and the crime boss's deal with an underground demon. Victory earns freedom for the enslaved fighters and control of the fighting ring. The party can shut it down, reform it into legitimate combat sports, or take it over for profit and influence in the criminal underworld.
resolutions.requirements: Combat prowess or backing skilled fighter, investigation of fixed matches, confrontation with crime boss and demon, moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Fighter gratitude and loyalty, control of fight club (income/influence), demon combat or banishment, underworld reputation

resolutions.title: Ring Destroyed
resolutions.description: The corruption runs too deep—the entire operation feeds a demon cult using fighter deaths as sacrifices. The party must evacuate fighters and audience before collapsing the arena chamber, sealing the demon below. But this will anger powerful crime figures who were invested in the operation, and the displaced fighters will have nowhere to go. The party must find safe refuge for former fighters while dealing with criminal retaliation.
resolutions.requirements: Combat with demon cultists, tactical chamber collapse, evacuation under pressure, dealing with criminal consequences, aiding displaced fighters
resolutions.rewards: Demon threat eliminated, rescued fighters (potential recruits/contacts), criminal syndicate enemy, moral victory with messy aftermath

urban.title: The Public Bathhouse
descriptions: A place of relaxation and gossip for the city's citizens. The steam rooms are filled with whispered secrets, and the massage tables are privy to all sorts of confessions. A corrupt politician is making a deal with a foreign spy, and a serial killer is stalking the bathhouse's patrons.

Steam and hushed voices fill the public baths where class distinctions dissolve in shared pools. Today the atmosphere is tense—a high-profile patron was found dead in a private steam room, and the bathhouse has been sealed. Everyone present is a suspect, from the politician in corner negotiations to the mysterious regular who always wears gloves. The killer is still here, and they know the party is investigating.

resolutions.title: Murder Solved
resolutions.description: The party unravels a complex web of blackmail, espionage, and revenge. The victim was a foreign agent, the politician was being blackmailed, and the killer is the bathhouse owner—who discovered their spouse was one of the agent's targets. The party must decide whether to turn in the owner (who had sympathetic motives), expose the spy ring, or use the information as leverage. Each choice has diplomatic consequences.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation in confined social setting, interrogation of suspects, insight to detect lies, discretion with sensitive information
resolutions.rewards: Choice of: bathhouse owner's gratitude, politician's favor, spy network intelligence, diplomatic leverage, or multiple faction rewards if navigated carefully

resolutions.title: Serial Killer Captured
resolutions.description: The victim wasn't the first—they're the latest in a string of murders. The party discovers the killer is a bathhouse attendant with an otherworldly patron, collecting souls through drowning rituals in specific pools. The killer has already marked their next victim—someone in the party. They must identify the killer, protect the marked target, and stop the ritual before the entity manifests through the bathhouse's central pool.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of murder pattern, protection of marked party member, combat with possessed killer, disruption of summoning ritual
resolutions.rewards: Multiple lives saved, otherworldly entity banished, bathhouse cleansed, city guard gratitude, possible cursed artifact recovered

urban.title: The Grand Theater
descriptions: A magnificent theater where the city's finest actors perform. The stage is set for a tragedy, but the real drama is happening backstage. A jealous understudy is plotting to sabotage the lead actor, and a cursed play is driving the cast and crew to madness.

Opening night of the legendary Lost King's Tragedy—a play that hasn't been performed in a century for good reason. The rehearsals have been plagued by accidents, the lead actor hears voices from the empty balconies, and the director insists the show must go on despite three cast members collapsing. The cursed script is rewriting itself, and the boundary between performance and reality grows thinner with each scene.

resolutions.title: Show Stopped
resolutions.description: The party investigates and discovers the play is a ritual that summons the spirit of the Lost King, seeking to reclaim his throne through possession of the lead actor. They must stop the performance before the final act, exorcise the restless royal spirit, and deal with the director—who knowingly staged the cursed play as revenge against the city that executed his ancestor, the Lost King. The gathered nobles in the audience don't realize how close they came to supernatural catastrophe.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of play's history, combat/exorcism of Lost King's spirit, stopping performance without causing panic, confronting director
resolutions.rewards: Noble gratitude for prevented catastrophe, exorcised spirit's treasure cache, theater preservation, historical artifacts, director's confession implicates others

resolutions.title: Performance Completed
resolutions.description: The party arrives too late—the final scene begins and the Lost King manifests. But an unexpected twist: the king doesn't seek conquest. He was unjustly executed and the play is his only way to communicate the truth about a greater betrayal. The party must decide whether to help him reveal the conspiracy (which will shake the city's noble families), banish him back to the afterlife, or negotiate a peaceful resolution where his truth is told but his spirit finally rests.
resolutions.requirements: Communication with spirit, investigation of historical conspiracy, negotiation between worlds, moral choice with political consequences
resolutions.rewards: Lost King's truth revealed (campaign-changing history), spirit's blessing/treasure, noble house conspiracies exposed, or peaceful resolution with spirit's gratitude

urban.title: The City Gates
descriptions: The main entrance to the city, a bustling chokepoint for travelers and trade. The city guard is on high alert, searching for a notorious fugitive. A caravan of refugees is seeking asylum, and a doomsday prophet is preaching to the crowds.

The gates are clogged with desperate humanity—refugees fleeing war, merchants whose goods rot in the sun, and travelers caught in lockdown. The guard captain has orders to let no one in until a fugitive is found, but tensions rise by the hour. The refugees include women and children, the merchants are losing fortunes, and the prophet's crowd grows as they preach that this is the first sign of the end times.

resolutions.title: Fugitive Captured
resolutions.description: The party identifies the fugitive—a shapeshifter hiding among the refugees. But they discover the 'fugitive' is actually a witness to noble corruption, fleeing assassination. The guard captain knows but follows orders. The party must choose: turn in the witness to open the gates (dooming the witness but saving the refugees), help the witness escape (keeping gates closed longer), or expose the corrupt nobles ordering the manhunt.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation to find shapeshifter, insight into political situation, moral choice with consequences
resolutions.rewards: Choice of: refugee gratitude, witness's evidence (political leverage), noble favor (if witness turned in), or reformed guard captain as ally

resolutions.title: Gates Forced Open
resolutions.description: No fugitive exists—the lockdown is a power play by paranoid nobles fearing plague or revolution. The party discovers evidence and must decide how to act. They can present proof to force the gates open peacefully, rally the crowd to overwhelm the guards (risking violence), or sneak people through smuggler tunnels. Each approach has different consequences for the city's stability.
resolutions.requirements: Investigation of orders, social challenges with factions, decision-making under pressure, possible crowd control or smuggling
resolutions.rewards: Massive refugee gratitude (future allies), merchant connections, guard captain's respect (if handled well), or noble enmity

urban.title: The Cemetery
urban.description: A silent city of the dead, where the tombstones tell stories of lives long past. A group of necromancers is performing a dark ritual, and the ghost of a murdered noble is haunting the cemetery, seeking justice.

urban.title: The Courthouse
urban.description: A place of law and order, where justice is supposed to be blind. But the scales are tipped in favor of the wealthy and powerful. A corrupt judge is taking bribes, and an innocent person is about to be sentenced to death.

urban.title: The Shady Moneylender
urban.description: A cramped, dusty shop where a notorious moneylender does business. The air is thick with the smell of old coins and desperation. The moneylender is known for his exorbitant interest rates and his ruthless enforcers. A desperate citizen is pleading for an extension on their loan, and the moneylender is about to make an example of them.

urban.title: The Corrupt Guard Captain
urban.description: A decorated captain of the city guard is secretly in the pocket of a powerful crime lord. The captain is meeting with his underworld contact in a seedy tavern to exchange information. A young, idealistic guard has grown suspicious of his captain and is tailing him, hoping to expose his corruption.

urban.title: The Haunted Orphanage
urban.description: A dilapidated orphanage that is rumored to be haunted by the ghosts of the children who died there. The children's laughter can be heard echoing through the empty halls, and their ghostly figures can be seen playing in the overgrown yard. The headmistress is a cruel woman who is hiding a dark secret about the orphanage's past.

urban.title: The Smuggler's Den
urban.description: A hidden den in the city's bustling port, where a crew of smugglers is unloading a shipment of illegal goods. The air is thick with the smell of saltwater and contraband. The smugglers are on high alert, as they have been tipped off that the city guard is planning a raid.

urban.title: The Rat-Catchers' Guild
urban.description: The headquarters of the city's rat-catchers, a grimy and boisterous guildhall located in the sewers. The rat-catchers are a rough-and-tumble bunch, but they are fiercely loyal to their own. They are celebrating a recent victory over a particularly large dire rat, and the ale is flowing freely.

urban.title: The Executioner's Block
urban.description: A crowd has gathered in the city square to witness a public execution. The mood is a mixture of morbid curiosity and grim satisfaction. The condemned is a notorious criminal, but some whisper that he is innocent. A daring rescue attempt is about to be made.

urban.title: The Political Rally
urban.description: A charismatic politician is addressing a large crowd in the city square, his words stirring up a frenzy of patriotic fervor. But not everyone is a supporter. A group of hecklers is trying to disrupt the rally, and a rival politician has hired an assassin to eliminate the speaker.

urban.title: The Dragon's Breath Tavern
urban.description: A rowdy tavern frequented by dragon-worshipping cultists. The air is thick with the smell of sulfur and cheap ale. The cultists are trying to recruit new members, and they are not taking no for an answer. A disguised city guard is trying to gather information on the cult's activities.

urban.title: The Alchemist's Guild
urban.description: The headquarters of the city's alchemists, a building filled with the bubbling of strange concoctions and the smell of exotic ingredients. The alchemists are a secretive and competitive bunch, and they are all vying to create the next great discovery. An experiment has gone horribly wrong, and a volatile potion is about to explode.

urban.title: The Beggar's Court
urban.description: A hidden courtyard where the city's beggars have formed their own society, with a king, a queen, and a court of jesters and thieves. The Beggar King is a shrewd and charismatic leader who rules his subjects with a firm but fair hand. He is holding court, settling disputes and dispensing justice.

urban.title: The Poisoned Playwright
urban.description: The city's most celebrated playwright has been found dead in his private theater box, a half-empty wine glass still clutched in his rigid fingers. The performance continues below, unaware, as crimson curtains sway and gaslight flickers across gilded balconies. Four suspects with motive and opportunity scatter into the night—each fleeing to their own refuge. The poisoner must be found before dawn, when the scandal breaks and evidence vanishes with the morning fog.

resolutions.title: Justice Prevails
resolutions.description: The party gathers irrefutable evidence from the morgue's toxicology report, the apothecary's purchase records, and witness testimonies. Confronting the murderer with proof of means, motive, and opportunity, they secure a confession. The city watch arrives to make the arrest as dawn breaks, preserving the playwright's reputation and bringing the killer to justice before the scandal can spread.
resolutions.requirements: Evidence from at least 3 locations, successful Investigation checks
resolutions.rewards: Gratitude from the theater guild, monetary reward from the victim's estate, reputation boost in high society

resolutions.title: Secrets Buried
resolutions.description: The investigation reveals that the truth would destroy multiple innocent lives—the playwright's hidden affairs, the rival's desperate debts, the apothecary's illegal side business. The party must choose: expose the killer and ruin many, or arrange a quiet solution. Perhaps the murderer agrees to exile, a false story is concocted, or powerful patrons make the evidence disappear. The fog rolls in, and with it, the secrets.
resolutions.requirements: Discovery of blackmail materials and love letters, negotiation with involved parties
resolutions.rewards: Favors owed from powerful NPCs, blackmail material for future use, guilty conscience

resolutions.title: Race Against Dawn
resolutions.description: Time runs out before all evidence can be collected. The party must make a dramatic choice at the morgue as the first light of dawn appears: present what they have to the authorities and hope it's enough, confront the suspected killer directly in a tense standoff, or watch helplessly as the murderer destroys key evidence and escapes into the morning crowds. Their incomplete investigation has consequences.
resolutions.requirements: Failure to visit all locations or failed time-sensitive skill checks
resolutions.rewards: Partial truth revealed, ongoing quest to find the escaped killer, lessons learned about time management

arctic.title: Frozen Wasteland Trek
descriptions: A pale sun hangs low over a horizon of endless white, casting long shadows that creep like ghosts across the tundra. Each breath crystallizes in the air, glittering briefly before the wind snatches it away. The snow underfoot groans, hinting at hollow chambers and hidden crevasses. Distant howls ride the gale, promising that the wasteland is anything but empty.

The blizzard hit three hours ago and shows no sign of stopping. Visibility drops to arm's length as whiteout conditions erase the world. The party's guide collapsed an hour back—either hypothermia or something worse. Supplies are dwindling, shelter is nowhere, and the compass spins uselessly. Something large is circling the party just beyond the curtain of snow, its footfalls barely audible over the screaming wind.

resolutions.title: Shelter Found
resolutions.description: The party discovers an ancient waystation half-buried in snow—a relic from when caravans regularly crossed these wastes. Inside they find frozen corpses of previous travelers, supplies, and a journal detailing a safer route. But they also find evidence that something has been using this shelter as a feeding ground. They can rest and recover here, but must decide whether to investigate the predator's lair or move on quickly with the route information.
resolutions.requirements: Survival checks to find shelter, investigation of waystation, decision about predator threat
resolutions.rewards: Rest and recovery, route map (advantage on future arctic travel), supplies, predator intelligence, or combat with territorial beast

resolutions.title: Nomad Rescue
resolutions.description: As hypothermia sets in, the party is rescued by arctic nomads who appear from the storm. The nomads demand payment for the rescue—either coin, labor, or a dangerous favor. Their camp reveals they're refugees fleeing something that destroyed their homeland. The party must recover, navigate the social dynamics of desperate people, and decide whether to help them face what they're running from.
resolutions.requirements: Survival to last until rescue, negotiation with nomads, investigation of their story, moral choice
resolutions.rewards: Life saved, arctic survival knowledge, nomad allies or debt, information about regional threat, potential quest hook

arctic.title: The Avalanche Path
arctic.description: Jagged peaks loom above a narrow trail carved into the mountain’s flank. Fresh fractures zigzag across the snowpack, warning that the slightest vibration could send tons of powder roaring downward. The crunch of boots is muffled by the heavy silence of a world holding its breath. Far below, the valley waits like an open grave for the unwary.

arctic.title: Ice Cave Exploration
arctic.description: The cave mouth exhales air colder than the night sky, carrying the scent of mineral-laced water. Vaulted ceilings glitter with stalactites that chime softly as hidden drafts stir their crystalline lengths. Bioluminescent algae trace luminous veins along the walls, revealing tunnels that twist into darkness. Every echo threatens to wake whatever ancient guardian slumbers beneath the ice.

arctic.title: Blizzard Survival
arctic.description: Snowflakes the size of daggers whirl in a howling storm that erases horizon and sky alike. Visibility shrinks to arm’s length as the wind scours exposed skin raw. The world becomes a battlefield of instinct and endurance, where shelter is a distant memory. Only the sharpest senses can separate the cries of allies from the wails of the blizzard.

arctic.title: Glacier Crossing
arctic.description: A frozen river of blue-white ice stretches ahead, its surface striated with centuries of relentless flow. Deep fissures glimmer with unfathomable depths, bridged only by tenuous snow bridges. Sunlight refracts into prismatic shards, dazzling the eye and hiding treacherous slopes. Each careful step echoes with the groan of ancient ice shifting in protest.

arctic.title: The Whiteout
arctic.description: The landscape dissolves into a featureless blur where ground and sky merge into a single blinding sheet. Sound is muffled to a dull hum, leaving travelers alone with their pounding hearts. Footprints vanish moments after they are made, swallowed by swirling powder. Without keen navigation, the party could march in circles until exhaustion claims them.

arctic.title: Frostbite Pass
arctic.description: A knife-edged wind slices through layers of fur and leather as the pass funnels the cold into a vicious gale. Frost feathers cling to every exposed surface, sparkling like malicious jewels. Frozen cairns mark the graves of those who misjudged the crossing. The path ahead is a gauntlet of sheer walls, icy switchbacks, and unseen predators stalking the heights.

arctic.title: Icebound Peaks
arctic.description: Snow-crowned mountains pierce the clouds, their slopes scarred by avalanches and ancient dragon claws. Thin air bites at lungs while the sun dances off fields of jagged ice. Wind-carved statues of heroes and monsters seem to watch every ascent with frozen approval. Somewhere above, the rattle of falling scree warns that the mountain tests all who dare climb it.

arctic.title: Aurora-Wreathed Battlefield
arctic.description: Ribbons of green and violet fire ripple across a sky that refuses to sleep. Frost-rimed armor litters the snow, humming with residual war-magic. Footsteps crunch atop buried banners that twitch like they still remember the charge. The aurora answers spoken oaths with sparks, eager to crown a new victor or curse a coward.

arctic.title: Hunter on the Black Ice
arctic.description: A mirror-dark lake stretches to the horizon, its glassy surface spiderwebbed with ancient cracks. Below, shadowy shapes glide with predatory grace, tracking every vibration. Wind skates over the ice, carrying the click of claws against the underside. One misstep becomes a plunge into a mouth full of winter.

ocean.title: Storm-Tossed Voyage
descriptions: Waves slam into the hull with bone-rattling force as thunderheads bruise the sky overhead. Crew members shout over the roar of wind and cracking sails, their faces lit by jagged lightning. The ship pitches wildly, revealing brief glimpses of black water filled with ghostly foam. In the chaos, something massive circles beneath the surface, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.

The hurricane appeared from nowhere, as if summoned. The captain screams that this is no natural storm—the clouds form spiraling symbols of an ancient sea god's wrath. Water floods the lower decks, the mast cracks ominously, and crew members are swept overboard. The ship won't survive another hour. The party must choose: abandon ship in lifeboats, attempt desperate repairs, or discover why the sea god is angry and appease it before everyone drowns.

resolutions.title: Ship Saved
resolutions.description: Through heroic effort, magical intervention, or clever sailing, the party keeps the ship afloat long enough to reach the eye of the storm. There they find a maelstrom with a gateway to an underwater temple. The sea god's priest emerges, explaining the captain violated sacred waters. The party must mediate: convince the god to spare the ship in exchange for penance, or defend the ship against divine wrath. Either choice has lasting consequences.
resolutions.requirements: Skill challenges to save ship (athletics, nature, spellcasting), investigation of the violation, diplomacy or combat with sea priest
resolutions.rewards: Ship and crew saved, sea god's grudging respect (if mediated), sacred waters knowledge, or divine curse if fought

resolutions.title: Shipwrecked
resolutions.description: The ship breaks apart in the storm. The party and handful of survivors wash ashore on an uncharted island. Wreckage and supplies scatter across the beach. The island seems uninhabited but shows signs of ancient civilization. The party must establish shelter, find food and water, explore the ruins, and discover a way off the island—all while the surviving crew looks to them for leadership and hope dwindles.
resolutions.requirements: Survival checks for shipwreck, leadership of survivors, island exploration, discovering escape method
resolutions.rewards: Survival skills tested, discovery of lost island civilization, ancient ruins and treasures, eventual rescue or ship building, crew loyalty, campaign detour

ocean.title: The Coral Labyrinth
ocean.description: A riot of color surrounds the party as living coral spires arch into a cathedral of the sea. Schools of curious fish dart between tunnels lit by shafts of liquid sunlight. Every turn reveals new wonders and lurking predators hidden among the reef’s crevices. Even the water seems to hum with ancient songs that promise both guidance and doom.

ocean.title: Derelict Ship Discovery
ocean.description: The shattered silhouette of a once-proud vessel looms through the fog, its rigging hanging like torn shrouds. Waterlogged decks groan underfoot, releasing the scent of salt, pitch, and old ghosts. Barnacles have claimed the figurehead, yet the captain’s cabin still holds a flicker of lantern light. Whatever remains aboard does not rest easy and may resent fresh intruders.

ocean.title: Island Approach
ocean.description: A palm-lined shore rises from the mist, crowned by cliffs that glitter with waterfalls and hidden caves. The surf hisses across the sand like a warning whispered in an unfamiliar tongue. Exotic birds wheel overhead, their cries echoing off jagged rocks. As the tide pulls back, strange footprints reveal that someone—or something—awaits the landing party.

ocean.title: Deep Water Descent
ocean.description: Sunlight dwindles to a turquoise haze as the party sinks into the abyssal chill. Strange bioluminescent creatures drift like lanterns in a submerged night sky. Pressure squeezes armor plates and lungs alike, demanding calm focus. Below, a dark silhouette yawns open, inviting exploration and threatening oblivion.

ocean.title: The Doldrums
ocean.description: The sea lies glassy and unmoving, trapping the vessel beneath a pitiless, blazing sun. Sails hang limp while the crew mutters about omens and restless spirits. Mirages dance on the horizon, promising salvation that never arrives. At night the silence is so deep that whispered fears become as loud as cannon fire.

ocean.title: Reef of Bones
ocean.description: Storm-broken masts and the skeletons of colossal sea beasts jut from the shallows like jagged teeth. Water crashes through ribcages and shattered decks, filling the air with a hollow wail. Treasures glint between the wreckage, guarded by territorial scavengers and the ghosts of drowned sailors. Navigating this graveyard demands steady hands and braver hearts.

ocean.title: Siren's Channel
ocean.description: The current twists into a seductive spiral, drawing ships toward cliffs studded with razor coral. Ethereal voices weave through the mist, promising love, glory, and long-lost companions. Waves shimmer with illusory visions that blur the line between memory and temptation. Those who cannot anchor their minds will join the wrecks that litter the channel floor.

ocean.title: Eye of the Maelstrom
ocean.description: Walls of water rise like cathedral buttresses, circling a calm heart where gulls hang frozen in the gale. Lightning crawls along the waves instead of the sky, sketching sigils in foaming arcs. The helm bucks with a will of its own, eager to surrender to the pull. Only a sacrifice or a secret name will buy a way out.

ocean.title: Kelp Forest Ambush
ocean.description: Sun pillars sift through towering fronds that sway like the lungs of the sea. Spear-thin leaves rasp against armor, disguising the approach of silent hunters. Lost harpoons and rusted coins dangle from the kelp like trophies. Disturb the canopy and the forest answers with tangle, tooth, and tide.

space.title: Derelict Spelljammer
space.description: The husk of a once-majestic spelljammer drifts silently through the void, its hull pitted by micrometeors and arcane scorch marks. Ghostly lights flicker in cracked portholes as if the crew still prowls their shattered decks. The silence is so profound that each footfall rings like a bell. Ancient runes along the keel pulse weakly, begging for rescue or promising a final curse.

space.title: Phlogiston Crossing
space.description: The rainbow currents of the phlogiston wrap the ship in vibrant auroras that dance across every surface. Trails of elemental fire curl around the hull, eager to ignite the slightest spark. Navigation charts glow with shifting runes that refuse to settle on a single path. One misjudged maneuver could send the vessel cascading into a cosmic bonfire.

space.title: Crystal Sphere Breach
space.description: A jagged wound opens in the crystalline barrier, bleeding motes of starlight into the void. Arcane lightning crackles along the rim, seeking to fuse the rupture closed or blast interlopers into powder. Beyond the breach lies a realm of unknown constellations and unclaimed secrets. The ship’s wards groan under the strain, demanding swift action to survive the crossing.

space.title: Astral Debris Field
space.description: A glittering storm of shattered hulls, broken asteroids, and drifting ice encircles the ship like a crown of daggers. Each fragment spins with lethal grace, reflecting the glow of distant suns. Echoes of old battles haunt the field, whispering fragments of unfinished orders. Piloting through this chaos requires nerves of steel and hands steady as a clockwork heart.

space.title: Wildspace Anomaly
space.description: A sphere of warped starlight pulses ahead, bending gravity and time like taffy. Colors beyond mortal comprehension ripple across its surface, illuminating strange glyphs that hover in midair. Instruments scream conflicting readings, while the crew feels memories slip sideways. The anomaly beckons with promises of insight—and the risk of never returning whole.

space.title: The Rainbow Flow
space.description: Ribbons of chromatic fire weave an ever-shifting river through the void, humming with raw planar energy. The ship shudders as currents tug at its keel, threatening to hurl it off course. Strange creatures made of pure light ride the flow, leaving contrails of laughter in their wake. Only precise spellwork can keep the vessel from dissolving into the prismatic torrent.

space.title: Sphere's Edge
space.description: The boundary of the crystal sphere looms like a glass horizon, reflecting alien stars in its polished curve. Gravity falters at the edge, making every movement feel dreamlike and unsteady. Through the transparent shell, other worlds glitter with silent invitation. Breaching this liminal space requires courage, finesse, and the favor of the cosmos itself.

space.title: Gravity Well
space.description: An invisible fist seizes the ship, dragging it toward a swirling maw of compressed starlight. Loose equipment and crew alike feel the pull, straining harnesses and fraying nerves. The hull groans as arcane wards flare, trying to counter the crushing force. Only quick adjustments and daring spellcraft can free the vessel from the well’s hungry grasp.

space.title: Siege of the Living Voidship
space.description: Organic tendrils lash out from a titanic voidship grown from the flesh of a forgotten god. Bioluminescent eyes line its carapace, tracking every movement with predatory patience. Boarding pods thump against the hull, disgorging chitin-clad warriors with hissing battle chants. Survival hinges on severing the creature’s neural conduits before it consumes the fleet.

space.title: Rescue at the Solar Flare Regatta
space.description: Solar sails billow like phoenix wings as racing ships skim the edge of a blazing star. A competitor’s vessel trails smoke and shattered rigging, spiraling toward a lethal flare. Crowds of spectators cheer from distant platforms, oblivious to the brewing disaster. The heroes must thread a path through magnetic storms to snatch the crew from a fiery demise.

space.title: Moondust Corsair Ambush
space.description: Silvery motes cling to the ship’s hull as it drifts through a cloud of moondust, masking the approach of lurking corsairs. Pirate vessels emerge from the glittering haze, their cannons charged with lunar frost. Cutthroats hail over open channels, offering surrender with mocking courtesy. The slightest hesitation could see the heroes boarded and their cargo plundered.

space.title: Chronal Drift Salvage
space.description: Fragments of wreckage shimmer in and out of existence, trapped in a loop of fractured time. Echoes of the crew flicker like ghosts, repeating their final moments in reverse and slow motion. Instruments tick backward while hourglasses pour sand upward into the sky. Salvaging this site means navigating shifting timelines without erasing oneself from history.

space.title: Gith Armada Blockade
space.description: A formation of sleek githyanki warships hangs in disciplined silence, their crimson sails taut against the void. Psychic commands ripple between them, forming a net of intent around trespassers. Each vessel bristles with ballistae and boarding hooks forged from astral silver. To pass requires negotiation, deception, or the courage to shatter the blockade.

space.title: Phlogiston Bloom Storm
space.description: Flammable vapors coalesce into radiant blossoms that erupt across the void, shedding sparks like meteoric petals. The airless storm seethes with rainbow lightning eager to ignite anything unshielded. Navigational charts flare white-hot before cooling to ash. Only precise timing and protective wards can shepherd the crew through without a fiery end.

space.title: Nebula Sanctuary Negotiation
space.description: A tranquil eddy within the nebula shelters crystalline monasteries floating on tendrils of mist. Monastic caretakers greet visitors with serene smiles and telepathic hymns. The air hums with the thrum of psionic wards safeguarding refugees hidden within. One misstep in the negotiation could turn sanctuary into prison.

space.title: Crystal Sphere Siegebreakers
space.description: Massive siege engines the size of fortresses anchor themselves to the sphere’s surface, drilling luminous cracks into the cosmic shell. Arcane artillery roars in synchronized volleys while defenders scramble to reinforce failing wards. Shockwaves ripple through wildspace, threatening to hurl smaller ships into lethal debris. The heroes must decide whether to defend the sphere or exploit the chaos.

space.title: Starbeast Migration Crossing
space.description: Titanic silhouettes glide silently through the void, their bodies trailing constellations of glowing spores. Each breath they exhale creates gravity wells that tug at nearby ships. Herd guardians swoop around the migration, warning off predators and curious mortals alike. Crossing the path requires deference, patience, and a steady hand on the helm.

space.title: Planar Observatory Heist
space.description: Floating platforms encircle an obsidian observatory whose lenses peer into a dozen realities at once. Clockwork custodians march along suspended bridges, ticking in time with the universe’s heartbeat. Scholars clutch star charts infused with spells that could rewrite destinies. To steal here is to dance on the edge of revelation and catastrophe.

space.title: Comet-Tail Skimming
space.description: A luminous tail of ice and dust unfurls for leagues, glittering like a god’s veil. Instruments ice over mid-reading as volatile crystals sandblast the hull. Hitchhiking elementals trace glyphs across the sails, begging for passage or promising sabotage. Ride the wake just right and time itself seems to slingshot.

space.title: Star Map of the Mad Navigator
space.description: A derelict skiff drifts inside a sphere of chart-lines drawn in solid light. Constellations reorder at a whisper, locking and unlocking invisible doors between worlds. Journals nailed to the mast are written in overlapping hands—every one the captain’s. Solve the map’s riddle, or become another route scrawled in desperation.

crypt.title: The Ancient Tomb
crypt.description: Sand-choked hieroglyphs line the walls of a chamber sealed for millennia, their gold inlay still gleaming beneath layers of dust. The air is heavy with the scent of incense that burned out ages ago, mingled with the tang of cold stone. Shadows stretch from sarcophagi carved with watchful eyes. A faint susurrus of whispers promises rewards for reverence and curses for greed.

crypt.title: Forgotten Catacombs
crypt.description: Endless tunnels twist beneath the earth, lined with niches overflowing with brittle bones. Dripping water marks a slow tempo, falling from ceilings furred with ghostly moss. The torchlight reveals faded murals depicting vows long broken. Every passage seems to breathe, eager to swallow intruders who stray too far from the path.

crypt.title: Cursed Burial Chamber
crypt.description: A sarcophagus of obsidian dominates the chamber, its surface etched with runes that pulse like a heartbeat. Chains of spectral light coil around the lid, rattling whenever the living draw near. The air tastes of iron and old resentment, prickling skin with unseen claws. Breaking the curse will mean facing the furious spirit still tethered to its throne.

crypt.title: The Silent Mausoleum
crypt.description: Marble statues stand sentinel in solemn rows, their faces veiled in mourning cloth. No breeze disturbs the hanging lanterns, yet their flames flicker as though something unseen passes by. The silence is so profound that even whispers feel like sacrilege. A single open door beckons deeper, promising revelations best left undisturbed.

crypt.title: Necropolis Depths
crypt.description: An underground city of the dead sprawls before the party, avenues of tombs stretching into the gloom. Ghostly lanterns glow in windows of stone houses built for spirits who never left. Echoes of funeral processions linger in the air, accompanied by spectral music. To walk these streets is to negotiate with history itself.

crypt.title: Ossuary Halls
crypt.description: Walls of carefully stacked skulls watch with hollow eyes as visitors tread the narrow corridors. Each skull bears carved runes detailing a life’s worth of secrets and sins. The scent of dry bone dust fills the lungs, making every breath feel heavier. Somewhere ahead, a ritual chamber waits to judge the living among the dead.

crypt.title: The Sealed Vault
crypt.description: An adamantine door bristling with locks bars entry to a treasury rumored to house sacred relics. Frost creeps across its surface despite the stagnant air, hinting at wards hungry to freeze intruders solid. The floor is inlaid with pressure plates disguised as intricate mosaics. Opening the vault promises riches—but may unleash the guardian bound within.

crypt.title: Mourner's Path
crypt.description: A winding corridor lined with funerary tapestries recounts the lineage of those interred beyond. Candles burn with unnaturally blue flames, casting mournful light on the stone. Soft sobbing echoes from unseen mourners, tugging at the heart with sorrow not entirely foreign. Each step forward requires a whispered apology to the dead.

crypt.title: Bell of the Last Rite
crypt.description: A dust-drowned chapel centers on a bronze bell veined with blackened silver. It tolls once whenever a lie is spoken, shaking loose ash that swirls into pleading shapes. The dead stir in their niches, waiting for a final confession. Ring it willingly and earn absolution—or strike it thrice and wake the warden.

crypt.title: The Ghoul Market
crypt.description: Lanterns of bottled witchfire illuminate stalls piled with teeth, memories, and lightly used limbs. Vendors with polite smiles haggle in whispers over favors owed by the living. A living customer is a novelty—and a delicacy—if etiquette fails. Bargain well, and the dead will honor the receipt.

forest.title: Dense Woodland Trail
descriptions: Towering trunks crowd the narrow trail, their branches knitting overhead to blot out the sun. Damp earth muffles footsteps while the scent of pine and rich loam fills the air. Distant birdcalls shift abruptly to silence as something unseen watches from the underbrush. Every bend hides a new secret waiting to be discovered—or sprung.
